page.title: 20CONTRIBUTING SCHOOLS
page.content: Overdale Junior School is 29 years old. It is set in a large tract of land with spinney, adventure playground and Washbrook. We take part in many sports, win some competitions. We have a good choir and orchestra. St. John the Baptist is the only Church of England aided primary school in Leicester. There are over 400 children housed in a single storey building opened in 1974. Brookside County Primary School was opened in 1973. It is named after Brookside Farm, which formerly stood on the site. It shares the campus with Manor High School who use our swimming pool. Stoneygate School is a private fee-paying school for children aged 7 to 13. It was founded in City centre buildings moving to its present grade 2 listed building about 120 years ago.
